text: Duncan Robert Fisher (August 30, 1927 - September 22, 2017) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player. He was born in Regina, Saskatchewan. He played 275 games in the National Hockey League from 1947 to 1953 and again in 1958 to 1959. He played for the New York Rangers, Boston Bruins, and Detroit Red Wings. Fisher died in Regina on September 22, 2017 at the age of 90. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Boston Bruins players Category:Detroit Red Wings players Category:Hershey Bears players Category:Ice hockey people from Saskatchewan Category:New Haven Ramblers players Category:New York Rangers players Category:Sportspeople from Regina, Saskatchewan
title: Dunc Fisher
